item.question: What does the Cebuano speaker say when parting ways at the end of the conversation?
item.hint: Listen again to the Cebuano speaker's last statement.
item.feedback: Correct. The Cebuano speaker says, Sige magkita ta taodtaod. (See you later.)

item.question: What is the Cebuano speaker's first response to the soldier's request to enter?
item.hint: Listen again to the Cebuano speaker's first response to the soldier's request. Palihog means please.
item.feedback: Correct. The Cebuano speaker says, Huwat palihog. (Please wait.)

item.question: What is the soldier's first question for the Cebuano speaker?
item.hint: Listen again to the soldier's first question.
item.feedback: Correct. The soldier asks, Kinsa man ning lalakiha? (Who is this man?)

item.question: What type of meat has the Cebuano speaker provided to the soldier?
item.hint: Listen again to the Cebuano speaker's response to the question, Manok ni o baboy? (Is this chicken or pork?)

item.question: How does the Cebuano speaker respond to the question, "Where is the interpreter?"
item.hint: Listen again to the Cebuano speaker's last statement.
item.feedback: Correct. The Cebuano speaker says, Ambot. (I don't know.)
